column5: But not fer me!!!! We're 6 months into our Northern winter and it still feels like the middle of winter up here. It's a balmy -49 with the wind this morning and I'm ticked because I don't want to walk 3 blocks into the wind to pick up a nice Mocha. I looks like it is going to start warming up un Sunday, if you can call -17 warm.

lol You gotta love YK, polar bear dip on July 1st. Funny thing about up there is that everyone has a $20k+ boat and they use it for 3 months of the year. I'll have to give my dad a shout tonight and see how he's enjoying his spring up there. Enjoy that spring Drifter...in June.
But its gotta be OHHH so worth it to wake up in that area everyday Aye drifter?
Ya got a good point there Drifter....BUT I'll be doing the    come softwater season thinkin about you fishing all those awesome Lakes up there

They are easier to get to when they are frozen. Late March and April are sweet months for ice fishing, relatively warm and super sunny all the time. You can get a pretty wicked sunburn here in the spring.   Blaque You said it. It's so much better  than commuting to Toronto every day. I just wish it was a bit warmer some times.
